places.name: India Gate
places.description: India Gate is a war memorial and an iconic landmark of Delhi, dedicated to the soldiers who died in World War I.
places.highlight: Visit in the evening for the beautifully lit India Gate.

places.name: Red Fort
places.location: Netaji Subhas Marg, Chandni Chowk, Delhi
places.description: Red Fort, also known as Lal Qila, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of India's rich history.
places.highlight: Explore the stunning architecture and historical significance.

places.name: Qutub Minar
places.description: Qutub Minar is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the tallest brick minaret in the world.
places.highlight: Climb to the top for panoramic views of Delhi.

places.name: Lotus Temple
places.description: Lotus Temple is a Bahá'í House of Worship known for its unique lotus-shaped architecture and serene ambiance.
places.highlight: Experience the tranquility of the temple's prayer hall.

places.name: Humayun's Tomb
places.description: Humayun's Tomb is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun.
places.highlight: Explore the beautiful Mughal architecture and lush gardens.

places.name: Akshardham Temple
places.description: Akshardham Temple is a stunning Hindu temple complex known for its intricate carvings and cultural exhibitions.
places.highlight: Attend the light and sound show in the evening.

places.name: Jama Masjid
places.description: Jama Masjid is one of the largest mosques in India, known for its stunning architecture and historical significance.
places.highlight: Climb the minaret for panoramic views of Old Delhi.

places.name: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib
places.description: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is a prominent Sikh shrine known for its peaceful ambiance and community kitchen.
places.highlight: Participate in langar (community meal) at the gurudwara.

places.name: Raj Ghat
places.description: Raj Ghat is the memorial of Mahatma Gandhi, the Father of the Nation, where he was cremated.
places.highlight: Pay homage to Mahatma Gandhi at this solemn memorial.

places.name: National Handicrafts & Handlooms Museum
places.description: The National Handicrafts & Handlooms Museum showcases a rich collection of traditional Indian crafts and textiles.
places.highlight: Discover the diversity of Indian craftsmanship.

places.name: National Rail Museum
places.description: The National Rail Museum is a fascinating museum dedicated to the history of railways in India.
places.highlight: Explore vintage locomotives and rail memorabilia.

places.name: Dilli Haat
places.description: Dilli Haat is an open-air market offering handicrafts, art, and a variety of regional cuisines from across India.
places.highlight: Shop for unique handicrafts and savor diverse Indian cuisine.

places.name: Nehru Planetarium
places.description: Nehru Planetarium offers an immersive experience in astronomy and space science.
places.highlight: Attend planetarium shows for a cosmic journey.

places.name: Chhatarpur Temple
places.description: Chhatarpur Temple is a beautiful Hindu temple complex known for its tranquility and intricate architecture.
places.highlight: Visit during morning prayers for a peaceful experience.

places.name: Nizamuddin Dargah
places.description: Nizamuddin Dargah is a Sufi shrine known for its spiritual ambiance and qawwali music performances.
places.highlight: Experience Sufi music and the timeless atmosphere.

places.name: National Zoological Park
places.description: The National Zoological Park houses a diverse collection of animals and is a great place for wildlife enthusiasts.
places.highlight: See endangered species and enjoy a day in nature.

places.name: Sanskriti Kendra Museum
places.description: Sanskriti Kendra Museum showcases Indian art, culture, and heritage through exhibitions and artifacts.
places.highlight: Explore the diverse cultural heritage of India.

places.name: Delhi Haunted House
places.description: Delhi Haunted House is a spooky attraction with haunted mazes and eerie experiences.
places.highlight: Brave the scares if you dare!

places.name: Nehru Memorial Museum & Library
places.description: Nehru Memorial Museum & Library is dedicated to India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru.
places.highlight: Learn about India's history and Nehru's legacy.
